lines.text: Enter DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and EROS, meeting

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: Caesar and Lepidus have made wars upon Pompey.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: This is old: what is the success?

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: Caesar, having made use of him in the wars 'gainst Pompey, presently denied him rivality; would not let him partake in the glory of the action: and not resting here, accuses him of letters he had formerly wrote to Pompey; upon his own appeal, seizes him: so the poor third is up, till death enlarge his confine.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Then, world, thou hast a pair of chaps, no more; And throw between them all the food thou hast, They'll grind the one the other. Where's Antony?

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: He's walking in the garden--thus; and spurns The rush that lies before him; cries, 'Fool Lepidus!' And threats the throat of that his officer That murder'd Pompey.

lines.speaker: eros
lines.text: For Italy and Caesar. More, Domitius; My lord desires you presently: my news I might have told hereafter.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: 'Twill be naught: But let it be. Bring me to Antony.
